name: semipalmated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a bird or its feet) with the front toes connected by skin along part of their length: A group of semipalmated plovers foraged on the flats. There were thousands of semi-palmated sandpipers. Semipalmate feet have partial webbing at the base of the three front-facing toes. Compare
palmate
webbed
More examplesFewer examplesHe has recorded a dramatic decline in the numbers of semipalmated sandpipers.Semipalmated and western sandpipers are so difficult to identify that they could almost drive you to give up birdwatching.A separate branch of waders developed semipalmated feet in many species.
